content:
MessageSecurityOverTcp Class

In this Article

Configures the message-level security for a message sent using the TCP transport.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class MessageSecurityOverTcp

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • MessageSecurityOverTcp

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

This object is accessed from the binding by using the Security property, which returns a NetTcpSecurity object. The Message property provides a reference to the MessageSecurityOverTcp object.

Constructors summary

MessageSecurityOverTcp()

Initializes a new instance of the MessageSecurityOverTcp class.

Properties summary

AlgorithmSuite

Specifies the algorithm suite to be used for securing messages at the SOAP level.
ClientCredentialType

Specifies the type of client credential the client uses to authenticate itself to the service at the SOAP level.

Constructors

  • MessageSecurityOverTcp()

    Initializes a new instance of the MessageSecurityOverTcp class.

    public MessageSecurityOverTcp ();

Properties

  • AlgorithmSuite

    Specifies the algorithm suite to be used for securing messages at the SOAP level.

    public System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite AlgorithmSuite { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • SecurityAlgorithmSuite

      A SecurityAlgorithmSuite. The default is stem.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256*.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The value of AlgorithmSuite is null.

    Remarks

    You should be aware of the strengths and weaknesses of the relevant algorithms when making modifications to this setting.

    If you set this property to a value other than the default and generate a configuration file using ServiceModel Metadata Utility Tool (Svcutil.exe), it is not generated correctly and you must manually edit the configuration file to set the corresponding configuration attribute to the desired value.

    Example

    The following code shows how to access and set this property. 

                    NetTcpBinding binding = new NetTcpBinding();
                // Specify the mode, then the credential type.
                binding.Security.Mode = SecurityMode.Message;
                binding.Security.Message.ClientCredentialType =
                    MessageCredentialType.UserName;
                binding.Security.Message.AlgorithmSuite =
                    System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256;

    				Dim binding As New NetTcpBinding()
				' Specify the mode, then the credential type.
				binding.Security.Mode = SecurityMode.Message
				binding.Security.Message.ClientCredentialType = MessageCredentialType.UserName
				binding.Security.Message.AlgorithmSuite = System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256
  • ClientCredentialType

    Specifies the type of client credential the client uses to authenticate itself to the service at the SOAP level.

    public System.ServiceModel.MessageCredentialType ClientCredentialType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • MessageCredentialType

      A MessageCredentialType. The default is MessageCredentialType.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value of ClientCredentialType is not a valid MessageCredentialType.

    Remarks

    The return value can be one of the following enumeration members:

    • HttpClientCredentialType
    • HttpClientCredentialType
    • HttpClientCredentialType
    • HttpClientCredentialType
    • HttpClientCredentialType
    • HttpClientCredentialType

    Example

    The following code shows how to access and set this property. 

                    NetTcpBinding binding = new NetTcpBinding();
                // Specify the mode, then the credential type.
                binding.Security.Mode = SecurityMode.Message;
                binding.Security.Message.ClientCredentialType =
                    MessageCredentialType.UserName;
                binding.Security.Message.AlgorithmSuite =
                    System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256;

    				Dim binding As New NetTcpBinding()
				' Specify the mode, then the credential type.
				binding.Security.Mode = SecurityMode.Message
				binding.Security.Message.ClientCredentialType = MessageCredentialType.UserName
				binding.Security.Message.AlgorithmSuite = System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256
